functionSignatures.name: add
functionSignatures.description: Returns the sum of the two provided integers.

functionSignatures.name: and
functionSignatures.description: Checks whether all parameter values are true.

functionSignatures.name: array
functionSignatures.description: Converts the value to an array.

functionSignatures.name: base64
functionSignatures.description: Returns the base64 representation of the input string.

functionSignatures.name: base64ToJson
functionSignatures.description: Converts a base64 representation to a JSON object.

functionSignatures.name: base64ToString
functionSignatures.description: Converts a base64 representation to a string.

functionSignatures.name: bool
functionSignatures.description: Converts the parameter to a boolean.

functionSignatures.name: coalesce
functionSignatures.description: Returns first non-null value from the parameters. Empty strings, empty arrays, and empty objects are not null.

functionSignatures.name: concat
functionSignatures.description: Combines multiple values and returns the concatenated result. This function can take any number of arguments, and can accept either strings or arrays for the parameters.

functionSignatures.name: contains
functionSignatures.description: Checks whether an array contains a value, an object contains a key, or a string contains a substring.

functionSignatures.name: copyIndex
functionSignatures.description:
Returns the current index of an iteration loop.
This function is always used with a copy object.

functionSignatures.name: createArray
functionSignatures.description: Creates an array from the parameters. If no parameters specified, creates an empty array.

functionSignatures.name: createObject
functionSignatures.description: Creates an object from the keys and values provided in the arguments.

functionSignatures.name: dataUri
functionSignatures.description: Converts a value to a data URI.

functionSignatures.name: dataUriToString
functionSignatures.description: Converts a data URI formatted value to a string.

functionSignatures.name: dateTimeAdd
functionSignatures.description: Adds a time duration to a base value. ISO 8601 format is expected.

functionSignatures.name: deployment
functionSignatures.description: Returns information about the current deployment operation. This function returns the object that is passed during deployment. The properties in the returned object will differ based on whether the deployment object is passed as a link or as an in-line object.

functionSignatures.name: div
functionSignatures.description: Returns the integer division of the two provided integers.

functionSignatures.name: empty
functionSignatures.description: Determines if an array, object, or string is empty.

functionSignatures.name: endsWith
functionSignatures.description: Determines whether a string ends with a value. The comparison is case-insensitive.

functionSignatures.name: environment
functionSignatures.description: Returns information about the current cloud environment. The function returns an object that contains endpoints and other information specific to the cloud used for the deployment.  The properties in the returned object may differ based on the capabilities of the cloud.

functionSignatures.name: equals
functionSignatures.description: Checks whether two values equal each other.

functionSignatures.name: extensionResourceId
functionSignatures.description: Returns the unique resource identifier of an extension resource. The resourceId parameter may be a resourceId of any scope or resourceId function. You use this function to create a resourceId for a given resource as required by a property value.

functionSignatures.name: false
functionSignatures.description: Returns a boolean value that is always false.

functionSignatures.name: first
functionSignatures.description: Returns the first element of the array, or first character of the string.

functionSignatures.name: float
functionSignatures.description: Converts the value to a floating point number. You only use this function when passing custom parameters to an application, such as a Logic App.

functionSignatures.name: format
functionSignatures.description: Creates a formatted string from input values. It uses the same formatting options as the System.String.Format method in .NET.

functionSignatures.name: greater
functionSignatures.description: Checks whether the first value is greater than the second value.

functionSignatures.name: greaterOrEquals
functionSignatures.description: Checks whether the first value is greater than or equal to the second value.

functionSignatures.name: guid
functionSignatures.description: This function is helpful when you need to create a value in the format of a globally unique identifier. You provide parameter values that limit the scope of uniqueness for the result. You can specify whether the name is unique down to subscription, resource group, or deployment. The returned value is not a random string, but rather the result of a hash function. The returned value is 36 characters long. It is not globally unique.

functionSignatures.name: if
functionSignatures.description: Returns a value based on whether a condition is true or false.

functionSignatures.name: indexOf
functionSignatures.description: Returns the first position of a value within a string. The comparison is case-insensitive.

functionSignatures.name: int
functionSignatures.description: Converts the specified value to Integer.

functionSignatures.name: intersection
functionSignatures.description: Returns a single array or object with the common elements from the parameters.

functionSignatures.name: items
functionSignatures.description: Returns an array of keys and values for an object. Elements are consistently ordered alphabetically by key.

functionSignatures.name: json
functionSignatures.description: Returns a JSON object from the specified string, or an empty object when null is specified

functionSignatures.name: last
functionSignatures.description: Returns the last element of the array, or last character of the string.

functionSignatures.name: lastIndexOf
functionSignatures.description: Returns the last position of a value within a string. The comparison is case-insensitive.

functionSignatures.name: length
functionSignatures.description: Returns the number of elements in an array or the number of characters in a string. You can use this function with an array to specify the number of iterations when creating resources.

functionSignatures.name: less
functionSignatures.description: Checks whether the first value is less than the second value.

functionSignatures.name: lessOrEquals
functionSignatures.description: Checks whether the first value is less than or equal to the second value.

functionSignatures.name: list
functionSignatures.description: Performs a GET call to a REST API on the given resource. The function arguments and the returned data depend on the resource type. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-resource-manager/templates/template-functions-resource#valid-uses.

functionSignatures.name: listAccountSas
functionSignatures.description: Creates and returns a SAS token with the specified permissions and expiry from the requestContent. The requestContent object must contain the signedServices, signedResourceTypes, signedPermission and signedExpiry properties.

functionSignatures.name: listAdminKeys
functionSignatures.description: Gets the primary and secondary admin API keys for the specified Azure Search service. The resourceId can be specified by using the resourceId function or by using the format providerNamespace/resourceType/resourceName. You can use the function to get the primaryKey and secondaryKey.

functionSignatures.name: listAuthKeys
functionSignatures.description: Retrieves the authentication keys for a DataFactory Integration Runtime. The resourceId can be specified by using the resourceId function or by using the format providerNamespace/resourceType/resourceName. You can use the function to get the available authkeys.

functionSignatures.name: listCallbackUrl
functionSignatures.description: Get callback URL for a trigger of a workflow version. The resourceId can be specified by using the resourceId function or by using the format providerNamespace/resourceType/resourceName. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/logic/WorkflowVersions/ListCallbackUrl#workflowtriggercallbackurl for more information.

functionSignatures.name: listChannelWithKeys
functionSignatures.description: Lists a Channel registration for a Bot Service including secrets.  The resourceId can be specified by using the resourceId function or by using the format providerNamespace/resourceType/resourceName. Example: [listChannelWithKeys(resourceId('Microsoft.BotService/botServices/channels', parameters('botId'), 'DirectLineChannel'), '2018-07-12').properties.properties.sites[0].key]

functionSignatures.name: listClusterAdminCredential
functionSignatures.description: Gets cluster admin credential of a managed cluster. Returns an array of objects with a 'name' and 'value' property. The resourceId can be specified by using the resourceId function or by using the format providerNamespace/resourceType/resourceName.

functionSignatures.name: listConnectionStrings
functionSignatures.description: Lists the connection strings for the specified Azure Cosmos DB database account. The resourceId can be specified by using the resourceId function or by using the format providerNamespace/resourceType/resourceName.

functionSignatures.name: listCredentials
functionSignatures.description: Lists the login credentials for the specified container registry. The resourceId can be specified by using the resourceId function or by using the format providerNamespace/resourceType/resourceName.

functionSignatures.name: listCredential
functionSignatures.description: Gets the accessProfile for the specified role for a managed cluster. The properties object contains a 'kubeConfig' property. The resourceId can be specified by using the resourceId function or by using the format providerNamespace/resourceType/resourceName.

functionSignatures.name: listKeys
functionSignatures.description: Returns the keys of a storage account. The resourceId can be specified by using the resourceId function or by using the format providerNamespace/resourceType/resourceName. You can use the function to get the primary (key[0]) and secondary key (key[1]).
functionSignatures.$comment: There are more than 20 possible return members, depending on the RP that's being queried.  This causes incorrect Intellisense and false positives for validation (in VS), so turning this off by not specifying returnValueMembers at all. VSCode doesn't show the same validation errors, but intelisense still won't show correct values, and it's easier to keep vscode and vs in sync, so doing it there, too.

functionSignatures.name: listKeyValue
functionSignatures.description: Returns a value from the App Config store with Key/Label specified in the request. The KeyLabelObject parameter is a JSON object with the two properties: "key" and "label" as required by the values in the store.

functionSignatures.name: listPackage
functionSignatures.description: Lists the virtual network gateway package. The resourceId can be specified by using the resourceId function or by using the format providerNamespace/resourceType/resourceName.

functionSignatures.name: listQueryKeys
functionSignatures.description: Returns the list of query API keys for the given Azure Search service. The resourceId can be specified by using the resourceId function or by using the format providerNamespace/resourceType/resourceName. The function returns an object array with a 'name' and 'key' property for each member.

functionSignatures.name: listSecrets
functionSignatures.description: List the secrets of a key vault. The resourceId can be specified by using the resourceId function or by using the format providerNamespace/resourceType/resourceName.

functionSignatures.name: listServiceSas
functionSignatures.description: Creates and returns a SAS token for the specific resource with the specified permissions and expiry from the requestContent. The requestContent object must contain the signedServices, signedResourceTypes, signedPermission and signedExpiry properties.

functionSignatures.name: listSyncFunctionTriggerStatus
functionSignatures.description: Returns the status of a function trigger. The resourceId can be specified by using the resourceId function or by using the format providerNamespace/resourceType/resourceName.

functionSignatures.name: managementGroup
functionSignatures.description: Returns a structured object that represents the current management group. This function is only valid in templates that are deployed at management group scope

functionSignatures.name: max
functionSignatures.description: Returns the maximum value from an array of integers or a comma-separated list of integers.

functionSignatures.name: min
functionSignatures.description: Returns the minimum value from an array of integers or a comma-separated list of integers.

functionSignatures.name: mod
functionSignatures.description: Returns the remainder of the integer division using the two provided integers.

functionSignatures.name: mul
functionSignatures.description: Returns the multiplication of the two provided integers.

functionSignatures.name: newGuid
functionSignatures.description: Returns a globally unique identifier (GUID). This function may only be used as a defaultValue on a parameter.

functionSignatures.name: not
functionSignatures.description: Converts boolean value to its opposite value.

functionSignatures.name: null
functionSignatures.description: Returns a value that is always null, equivalent to json('null').

functionSignatures.name: or
functionSignatures.description: Checks whether any parameter value is true.

functionSignatures.name: padLeft
functionSignatures.description: Returns a right-aligned string by adding characters to the left until reaching the total specified length.

functionSignatures.name: parameters
functionSignatures.description: Returns a parameter value. The specified parameter name must be defined in the parameters section of the template.

functionSignatures.name: pickZones
functionSignatures.description: Determines whether a resource type supports zones for a region.

functionSignatures.name: providers
functionSignatures.description: The providers function has been deprecated. We no longer recommend using it. If you used this function to get an API version for the resource provider, we recommend that you provide a specific API version in your template. Using a dynamically returned API version can break your template if the properties change between versions.

functionSignatures.name: range
functionSignatures.description: Creates an array of integers from a starting integer and containing a number of items.

functionSignatures.name: reference
functionSignatures.description: Enables an expression to derive its value from another resource's runtime state.

functionSignatures.name: replace
functionSignatures.description: Returns a new string with all instances of one character in the specified string replaced by another character.

functionSignatures.name: resourceGroup
functionSignatures.description: Returns a structured object that represents the current resource group.

functionSignatures.name: resourceId
functionSignatures.description: Returns the unique resource identifier of a resource group scoped resource. You use this function to create a resourceId for a given resource as required by a property value.

functionSignatures.name: skip
functionSignatures.description: Returns an array or string with all of the elements or characters after the specified number in the array or string.

functionSignatures.name: split
functionSignatures.description: Returns an array of strings that contains the substrings of the input string that are delimited by the sent delimiters.

functionSignatures.name: startsWith
functionSignatures.description: Determines whether a string starts with a value. The comparison is case-insensitive.

functionSignatures.name: string
functionSignatures.description: Converts the specified value to String.

functionSignatures.name: sub
functionSignatures.description: Returns the subtraction of the two provided integers.

functionSignatures.name: subscription
functionSignatures.description: Returns details about the subscription.

functionSignatures.name: subscriptionResourceId
functionSignatures.description: Returns the unique resource identifier of a subscription scoped resource. You use this function to create a resourceId for a given resource as required by a property value.

functionSignatures.name: substring
functionSignatures.description: Returns a substring that starts at the specified character position and contains the specified number of characters.

functionSignatures.name: take
functionSignatures.description: Returns an array or string with the specified number of elements or characters from the start of the array or string.

functionSignatures.name: tenant
functionSignatures.description: Returns a structured object that represents the current tenant.

functionSignatures.name: tenantResourceId
functionSignatures.description: Returns the unique resource identifier of a tenant scoped resource. You use this function to create a resourceId for a given resource as required by a property value.

functionSignatures.name: toLower
functionSignatures.description: Converts the specified string to lower case.

functionSignatures.name: toUpper
functionSignatures.description: Converts the specified string to upper case.

functionSignatures.name: trim
functionSignatures.description: Removes all leading and trailing white-space characters from the specified string.

functionSignatures.name: true
functionSignatures.description: Returns a boolean value that is always true.

functionSignatures.name: union
functionSignatures.description: Returns a single array or object with all elements from the parameters. Duplicate values or keys are only included once.

functionSignatures.name: uniqueString
functionSignatures.description:
Creates a deterministic hash string based on the values provided as parameters.
### Remarks
This function is helpful when you need to create a unique name for a resource. You provide parameter values that represent the level of uniqueness for the result. You can specify whether the name is unique for your subscription, resource group, or deployment.
The returned value isn't a random string, but rather the result of a hash function. The returned value is 13 characters long. It isn't globally unique. You may want to combine the value with a prefix from your naming convention to create a name that is meaningful.
### Example
`[concat('storage', uniqueString(resourceGroup().id))]`

functionSignatures.name: uri
functionSignatures.description: Creates an absolute URI by combining the baseUri and the relativeUri string.

functionSignatures.name: uriComponent
functionSignatures.description: Encodes a URI.

functionSignatures.name: uriComponentToString
functionSignatures.description: Returns a string of a URI encoded value.

functionSignatures.name: utcNow
functionSignatures.description: Returns the current (UTC) datetime value in the format provided. If no format is provided the ISO 8601 (yyyyMMddTHH:mm:ssZ) format will be used. This function may only be used as a defaultValue on a parameter.

functionSignatures.name: variables
functionSignatures.description: Returns the value of variable. The specified variable name must be defined in the variables section of the template.
